title: Add cs -adopt command to convert existing projects to cs sessions
description: Add a new cs -adopt <name> command that converts an existing project directory into a cs session in-place. Instead of moving files to ~/.claude-sessions/, it creates .cs/ metadata in the current directory and symlinks ~/.claude-sessions/<name> -> pwd. This preserves Claude Code conversation continuity since the cwd doesn't change. Key behaviors: (1) create .cs/ structure in cwd, (2) create/merge CLAUDE.md, (3) init git if needed, (4) create symlink from sessions root, (5) ensure cs list/resume works with symlinked sessions.
close_reason: Feature complete: adopt_session() with tests, symlink support, README docs
